domainElements.description:
Look at the <diagram name="hdole/madd">multiply-add example</diagram> add‚àò(Œ†<mult‚àòùëù‚Ää‚ÇÄ,‚Ää‚ÇÅ,ùëù‚Ää‚ÇÇ>):ùîΩ‚ÇÜ‚ÇÑ√óùîΩ‚ÇÜ‚ÇÑ‚ÜíùîΩ‚ÇÜ‚ÇÑ.¬† If only the
add and multiply are selected for generalization, then the replacements must have
matching domains and codomains specific to ùîΩ‚ÇÜ‚ÇÑ.¬† Selecting a diagram object ùîΩ‚ÇÜ‚ÇÑ
and the multiply and add then generalizes to a form like F√óF‚ÜíF
for some F.
Create a new diagram generalizing the user's appropriately selected elements.

A bare object or morphism is one that is not constructed by categorical operators
and has no data.

To create a new action, select bare objects or morphisms and lastly a named object
or morphism that uses all the selected elements, then a new action may be created.

All actions from all diagrams in the user‚Äôs session are available for the user
depending on the user‚Äôs selection of elements.  An action appears on the toolbar
for the user to invoke when the pattern of the action‚Äôs selected elements, minus
the named element, is matched.

When activated, a form shows the selected items and aspects of the contemplated
action.  A list of all bare objects and morphisms used by the named element and not
in the selected list are shown.  These bare elements must be used in the action.

A list of all diagrams that must be referenced is shown.  If an action is used in a
diagram, these reference diagrams are added as references in that diagram.

Objects and morphisms in the select list are said to be generalized for the action.
A conflict occurs if a selected object is attached to a morphism that has data as that
specific data cannot be generalized.
